New Records: Cleveland Cavaliers extended their winning streak to seven games with a 113-95 victory over the Golden State Warriors on December 31, 2024.
Key Match Events: Darius Garland picked off an errant Wiggins pass and scored on a layup to extend Clevelandâ€™s lead to 44-36 with just under two minutes in the first half, setting the tone for a decisive 20-5 run that put the game out of reach late in the third quarter.
Pre-Game Insights: The Cavaliers, with the best record in the league, were looking to extend their winning streak as they faced the Warriors, who were struggling after a poor performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Golden State has slipped to 12-3 after a strong start, with four losses in their last five games.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Warriors struggled from the field, shooting 33.3% overall and 23.7% from three-point range, while Cleveland capitalized with 45.8% shooting from the field and 38.3% from three-pointers.
Others: Cleveland's win improves their road trip record, while the Warriors face a tough opponent in the Philadelphia 76ers next.
